intro: Berchemia racemosa, commonly known as the yellow bellvista, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with compound leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Berchemia racemosa is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
